name: Dataset
title: Google
Cloud
Datastore
Dataset
description:
Dataset

Dataset is the data saved in a project’s Datastore. Dataset is analogous to a database in relational database world.

Google::Cloud::Datastore::Dataset is the main object for interacting with Google Datastore. Google::Cloud::Datastore::Entity objects are created, read, updated, and deleted by Google::Cloud::Datastore::Dataset.

See Google::Cloud#datastore

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/datastore"

datastore = Google::Cloud::Datastore.new

query = datastore.query("Task").
  where("done", "=", false)

tasks = datastore.run query

require "google/cloud/datastore"

datastore = Google::Cloud::Datastore.new(
  project: "my-todo-project",
  keyfile: "/path/to/keyfile.json"
)

datastore.project #=> "my-todo-project"

methods.name: allocate_ids
title: Google
Cloud
Datastore
Dataset#allocate_ids
methods.description: Generate IDs for a Key before creating an entity.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/datastore"

datastore = Google::Cloud::Datastore.new

task_key = datastore.key "Task"
task_keys = datastore.allocate_ids task_key, 5

params.name: incomplete_key
params.description: A Key without id or name set.

params.name: count
params.description: The number of new key IDs to create.

methods.name: save
title: Google
Cloud
Datastore
Dataset#save
methods.description: Persist one or more entities to the Datastore.

examples.caption: Insert a new entity:
examples.code:
require "google/cloud/datastore"

datastore = Google::Cloud::Datastore.new

task = datastore.entity "Task" do |t|
  t["type"] = "Personal"
  t["done"] = false
  t["priority"] = 4
  t["description"] = "Learn Cloud Datastore"
end
task.key.id #=> nil
datastore.save task
task.key.id #=> 123456

examples.caption: Insert multiple new entities in a batch:
examples.code:
require "google/cloud/datastore"

datastore = Google::Cloud::Datastore.new

task1 = datastore.entity "Task" do |t|
  t["type"] = "Personal"
  t["done"] = false
  t["priority"] = 4
  t["description"] = "Learn Cloud Datastore"
end

task2 = datastore.entity "Task" do |t|
  t["type"] = "Personal"
  t["done"] = false
  t["priority"] = 5
  t["description"] = "Integrate Cloud Datastore"
end

task_key1, task_key2 = datastore.save(task1, task2).map(&:key)

examples.caption: Update an existing entity:
examples.code:
require "google/cloud/datastore"

datastore = Google::Cloud::Datastore.new

task = datastore.find "Task", "sampleTask"
task["priority"] = 5
datastore.save task

params.name: entities
params.description: One or more entity objects to be saved.

methods.name: insert
title: Google
Cloud
Datastore
Dataset#insert
methods.description: Insert one or more entities to the Datastore. An InvalidArgumentError will raised if the entities cannot be inserted.

examples.caption: Insert a new entity:
examples.code:
require "google/cloud/datastore"

datastore = Google::Cloud::Datastore.new

task = datastore.entity "Task" do |t|
  t["type"] = "Personal"
  t["done"] = false
  t["priority"] = 4
  t["description"] = "Learn Cloud Datastore"
end
task.key.id #=> nil
datastore.insert task
task.key.id #=> 123456

examples.caption: Insert multiple new entities in a batch:
examples.code:
require "google/cloud/datastore"

datastore = Google::Cloud::Datastore.new

task1 = datastore.entity "Task" do |t|
  t["type"] = "Personal"
  t["done"] = false
  t["priority"] = 4
  t["description"] = "Learn Cloud Datastore"
end

task2 = datastore.entity "Task" do |t|
  t["type"] = "Personal"
  t["done"] = false
  t["priority"] = 5
  t["description"] = "Integrate Cloud Datastore"
end

task_key1, task_key2 = datastore.insert(task1, task2).map(&:key)

params.name: entities
params.description: One or more entity objects to be inserted.

methods.name: update
title: Google
Cloud
Datastore
Dataset#update
methods.description: Update one or more entities to the Datastore. An InvalidArgumentError will raised if the entities cannot be updated.

examples.caption: Update an existing entity:
examples.code:
require "google/cloud/datastore"

datastore = Google::Cloud::Datastore.new

task = datastore.find "Task", "sampleTask"
task["done"] = true
datastore.save task

examples.caption: Update multiple new entities in a batch:
examples.code:
require "google/cloud/datastore"

datastore = Google::Cloud::Datastore.new

query = datastore.query("Task").where("done", "=", false)
tasks = datastore.run query
tasks.each { |t| t["done"] = true }
datastore.update tasks

params.name: entities
params.description: One or more entity objects to be updated.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/datastore"

datastore = Google::Cloud::Datastore.new

datastore.delete task1, task2

params.name: entities_or_keys
params.description:
One or more Entity or Key
objects to remove.

methods.name: commit
title: Google
Cloud
Datastore
Dataset#commit
methods.description: Make multiple changes in a single commit.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/datastore"

datastore = Google::Cloud::Datastore.new

datastore.commit do |c|
  c.save task3, task4
  c.delete task1, task2
end

params.name: yield
params.description: a block for making changes

params.name: yield.commit
params.description: The object that changes are made on

examples.caption: Finding an entity with a key:
examples.code:
require "google/cloud/datastore"

datastore = Google::Cloud::Datastore.new

task_key = datastore.key "Task", "sampleTask"
task = datastore.find task_key

examples.caption: Finding an entity with a kind and id/name:
examples.code:
require "google/cloud/datastore"

datastore = Google::Cloud::Datastore.new

task = datastore.find "Task", "sampleTask"

params.name: key_or_kind
params.description: A Key object or kind string value.

params.name: id_or_name
params.description: The Key’s id or name value if a kind was provided in the first parameter.

params.name: consistency
params.description:
The non-transactional read consistency to use. Cannot be set to :strong for global queries. Accepted values are :eventual and :strong.

The default consistency depends on the type of lookup used. See Eventual Consistency in Google Cloud Datastore for more information.

methods.name: find_all
title: Google
Cloud
Datastore
Dataset#find_all
methods.description: Retrieve the entities for the provided keys. The order of results is undefined and has no relation to the order of keys arguments.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/datastore"

datastore = Google::Cloud::Datastore.new

task_key1 = datastore.key "Task", "sampleTask1"
task_key2 = datastore.key "Task", "sampleTask2"
tasks = datastore.find_all task_key1, task_key2

params.name: keys
params.description: One or more Key objects to find records for.

params.name: consistency
params.description:
The non-transactional read consistency to use. Cannot be set to :strong for global queries. Accepted values are :eventual and :strong.

The default consistency depends on the type of lookup used. See Eventual Consistency in Google Cloud Datastore for more information.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/datastore"

datastore = Google::Cloud::Datastore.new

query = datastore.query("Task").
  where("done", "=", false)
tasks = datastore.run query

examples.caption: Run an ancestor query with eventual consistency:
examples.code:
require "google/cloud/datastore"

datastore = Google::Cloud::Datastore.new

task_list_key = datastore.key "TaskList", "default"
query = datastore.query.kind("Task").
  ancestor(task_list_key)

tasks = datastore.run query, consistency: :eventual

examples.caption: Run the query within a namespace with the namespace option:
examples.code:
require "google/cloud/datastore"

datastore = Google::Cloud::Datastore.new

query = datastore.query("Task").
  where("done", "=", false)
tasks = datastore.run query, namespace: "ns~todo-project"

examples.caption: Run the query with a GQL string.
examples.code:
require "google/cloud/datastore"

datastore = Google::Cloud::Datastore.new

gql_query = datastore.gql "SELECT * FROM Task WHERE done = @done",
                          done: false
tasks = datastore.run gql_query

examples.caption: Run the GQL query within a namespace with namespace option:
examples.code:
require "google/cloud/datastore"

datastore = Google::Cloud::Datastore.new

gql_query = datastore.gql "SELECT * FROM Task WHERE done = @done",
                          done: false
tasks = datastore.run gql_query, namespace: "ns~todo-project"

params.name: query
params.description: The object with the search criteria.

params.name: namespace
params.description: The namespace the query is to run within.

params.name: consistency
params.description:
The non-transactional read consistency to use. Cannot be set to :strong for global queries. Accepted values are :eventual and :strong.

The default consistency depends on the type of query used. See Eventual Consistency in Google Cloud Datastore for more information.

examples.caption: Runs the given block in a database transaction:
examples.code:
require "google/cloud/datastore"

datastore = Google::Cloud::Datastore.new

task = datastore.entity "Task", "sampleTask" do |t|
  t["type"] = "Personal"
  t["done"] = false
  t["priority"] = 4
  t["description"] = "Learn Cloud Datastore"
end

datastore.transaction do |tx|
  if tx.find(task.key).nil?
    tx.save task
  end
end

examples.caption: If no block is given, a Transaction object is returned:
examples.code:
require "google/cloud/datastore"

datastore = Google::Cloud::Datastore.new

task = datastore.entity "Task", "sampleTask" do |t|
  t["type"] = "Personal"
  t["done"] = false
  t["priority"] = 4
  t["description"] = "Learn Cloud Datastore"
end

tx = datastore.transaction
begin
  if tx.find(task.key).nil?
    tx.save task
  end
  tx.commit
rescue
  tx.rollback
end

params.name: yield
params.description: a block yielding a new transaction

params.name: yield.tx
params.description: the transaction object

methods.name: query
title: Google
Cloud
Datastore
Dataset#query
methods.description: Create a new Query instance. This is a convenience method to make the creation of Query objects easier.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/datastore"

datastore = Google::Cloud::Datastore.new

query = datastore.query("Task").
  where("done", "=", false)
tasks = datastore.run query

examples.caption: The previous example is equivalent to:
examples.code:
require "google/cloud/datastore"

datastore = Google::Cloud::Datastore.new

query = Google::Cloud::Datastore::Query.new.
  kind("Task").
  where("done", "=", false)
tasks = datastore.run query

params.name: kinds
params.description: The kind of entities to query. This is optional.

methods.name: gql
title: Google
Cloud
Datastore
Dataset#gql
methods.description: Create a new GqlQuery instance. This is a convenience method to make the creation of GqlQuery objects easier.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/datastore"

datastore = Google::Cloud::Datastore.new

gql_query = datastore.gql "SELECT * FROM Task WHERE done = @done",
                          done: false
tasks = datastore.run gql_query

examples.caption: The previous example is equivalent to:
examples.code:
require "google/cloud/datastore"

datastore = Google::Cloud::Datastore.new

gql_query = Google::Cloud::Datastore::GqlQuery.new
gql_query.query_string = "SELECT * FROM Task WHERE done = @done"
gql_query.named_bindings = {done: false}
tasks = datastore.run gql_query

params.name: query
params.description: The GQL query string.

params.name: bindings
params.description: Named bindings for the GQL query string, each key must match regex [A-Za-z_$][A-Za-z_$0-9]*, must not match regex __.*__, and must not be "". The value must be an Object that can be stored as an Entity property value, or a Cursor.

methods.name: key
title: Google
Cloud
Datastore
Dataset#key
methods.description: Create a new Key instance. This is a convenience method to make the creation of Key objects easier.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/datastore"

datastore = Google::Cloud::Datastore.new

task_key = datastore.key "Task", "sampleTask"

examples.caption: The previous example is equivalent to:
examples.code:
require "google/cloud/datastore"

task_key = Google::Cloud::Datastore::Key.new "Task", "sampleTask"

examples.caption: Create an empty key:
examples.code:
require "google/cloud/datastore"

datastore = Google::Cloud::Datastore.new

key = datastore.key

examples.caption: Create an incomplete key:
examples.code:
require "google/cloud/datastore"

datastore = Google::Cloud::Datastore.new

key = datastore.key "User"

examples.caption: Create a key with a parent:
examples.code:
require "google/cloud/datastore"

datastore = Google::Cloud::Datastore.new

key = datastore.key [["TaskList", "default"],
                     ["Task", "sampleTask"]]
key.path #=> [["TaskList", "default"], ["Task", "sampleTask"]]

examples.caption: Create a key with multi-level ancestry:
examples.code:
require "google/cloud/datastore"

datastore = Google::Cloud::Datastore.new

key = datastore.key([
  ["User", "alice"],
  ["TaskList", "default"],
  ["Task", "sampleTask"]
])
key.path.count #=> 3
key.path[0] #=> ["User", "alice"]
key.path[1] #=> ["TaskList", "default"]
key.path[2] #=> ["Task", "sampleTask"]

examples.caption: Create an incomplete key with a parent:
examples.code:
require "google/cloud/datastore"

datastore = Google::Cloud::Datastore.new

key = datastore.key "TaskList", "default", "Task"
key.path #=> [["TaskList", "default"], ["Task", nil]]

examples.caption: Create a key with a project and namespace:
examples.code:
require "google/cloud/datastore"

datastore = Google::Cloud::Datastore.new

key = datastore.key ["TaskList", "default"], ["Task", "sampleTask"],
                    project: "my-todo-project",
                    namespace: "ns~todo-project"
key.path #=> [["TaskList", "default"], ["Task", "sampleTask"]]
key.project #=> "my-todo-project"
key.namespace #=> "ns~todo-project"

params.name: path
params.description:
An optional
list of pairs for the key’s path. Each pair may include the key’s
kind (String) and an id (Integer) or name (String). This is
optional.

params.name: project
params.description: The project of the Key. This is optional.

params.name: namespace
params.description: namespace kind of the Key. This is optional.

methods.name: entity
title: Google
Cloud
Datastore
Dataset#entity
methods.description: Create a new empty Entity instance. This is a convenience method to make the creation of Entity objects easier.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/datastore"

datastore = Google::Cloud::Datastore.new

task = datastore.entity

examples.caption: The previous example is equivalent to:
examples.code:
require "google/cloud/datastore"

task = Google::Cloud::Datastore::Entity.new

examples.caption: The key can also be passed in as an object:
examples.code:
require "google/cloud/datastore"

datastore = Google::Cloud::Datastore.new

task_key = datastore.key "Task", "sampleTask"
task = datastore.entity task_key

examples.caption: Or the key values can be passed in as parameters:
examples.code:
require "google/cloud/datastore"

datastore = Google::Cloud::Datastore.new

task = datastore.entity "Task", "sampleTask"

examples.caption: The previous example is equivalent to:
examples.code:
require "google/cloud/datastore"

task_key = Google::Cloud::Datastore::Key.new "Task", "sampleTask"
task = Google::Cloud::Datastore::Entity.new
task.key = task_key

examples.caption: The newly created entity can also be configured using block:
examples.code:
require "google/cloud/datastore"

datastore = Google::Cloud::Datastore.new

task = datastore.entity "Task", "sampleTask" do |t|
  t["type"] = "Personal"
  t["done"] = false
  t["priority"] = 4
  t["description"] = "Learn Cloud Datastore"
end

examples.caption: The previous example is equivalent to:
examples.code:
require "google/cloud/datastore"

task_key = Google::Cloud::Datastore::Key.new "Task", "sampleTask"
task = Google::Cloud::Datastore::Entity.new
task.key = task_key
task["type"] = "Personal"
task["done"] = false
task["priority"] = 4
task["description"] = "Learn Cloud Datastore"

params.name: key_or_path
params.description:
An
optional list of pairs for the key’s path. Each pair may include the
key’s kind (String) and an id (Integer) or name (String). This is
optional.

params.name: project
params.description: The project of the Key. This is optional.

params.name: namespace
params.description: namespace kind of the Key. This is optional.

params.name: yield
params.description: a block yielding a new entity

params.name: yield.entity
params.description: the newly created entity object
